main event: A UFO sighting was reported on 29th October 1952 near Long Island, New York. The object was pursued by two F-94 aircraft and maintained flight for a period of 1 to 2 minutes before escaping at high speed.
interesting points: The UFO sighting was reported by a civilian pilot and lasted for approximately 20 minutes.
The object was described as a dark object with a bright light that was pursued by two F-94 aircraft.
The document includes a hand-drawn sketch or diagram of the unidentified object's initial heading and its route during the contact.
An evaluation suggested the possibility of the object being attributed to an unscheduled balloon release from Mitchell AFB, as it was seen performing flight orbits and behaving like a balloon.
The report also includes a map of the Hudson River area, elevation information, and a detailed aeronautical chart of the region.
result: prosaic explanation: attributed to unscheduled balloon release from Mitchell AFB
